summary: REQ-49 is largely implemented: the “Why I Love You” modal now has a darker/blurred backdrop overlay plus a dedicated high-contrast dark panel behind each sequentially-fading line, with internal scrolling and correct click-outside-to-close behavior. One constraint appears unaddressed: respecting prefers-reduced-motion for the modal animations/timed fade-ins.

missing_requirements.requirement: Keep the app mobile-first and ensure changes respect prefers-reduced-motion where applicable (especially for modal animations / sequential fade-ins).
missing_requirements.reason: The modal still applies animation classes (e.g., animate-fade-in, animate-scale-in) and uses timed sequential reveals via setTimeout without any conditional handling for reduced-motion users in the shown changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Locking page scroll by setting document.body.style.overflow = 'hidden' while the modal is open.
hallucinated_features.reason: REQ-49/ACs require the modal body to be scrollable and usable, but do not explicitly request global body scroll locking; this is an additional behavior beyond the stated requirements.
